We need to incorporate that there are helper functions: _build_rst, escape_password, send_request, wsu_time_format. The file likely builds WS-Trust request, sends it, parses response. But no callers. So summary: module provides utilities for constructing and sending WS-Trust requests, handling timestamps, escaping passwords, and parsing responses. Business intent: support authentication flows using WS-Trust (e.g., acquiring tokens from ADFS). Keywords: ws-trust, authentication, request building, xml, timestamp, password escaping, token acquisition. Also note no usage. Provide JSON.assistantfinal{
  "summary": "This module contains a collection of helper utilities for constructing, formatting, and sending WS‑Trust XML requests, including timestamp formatting, password escaping, request body assembly, and response handling.",
  "business_intent": "To support WS‑Trust based authentication flows (e.g., acquiring security tokens from an ADFS or similar identity provider) by providing the low‑level request‑building and transmission logic needed for such protocols.",
  "keywords": [
    "WS-Trust",
    "authentication",
    "XML request",
    "timestamp formatting",
    "password escaping",
    "request construction",
    "token acquisition",
    "security token service"
  ]
}
